meta_description:
In Talladega Alabama where antebellum homes abound, a surprising jewel of the City for art and history lovers is the Jemison-Carnegie Heritage Hall Museum and Art Center.  This elegant building, built in 1906 was originally the Talladega Public Library, a product of Andrew Carnegie's nationwide library construction program.

https://heritagehallmuseum.org

213798772097098

admission_text:
#### Jemison-Carnegie Foundation Membership

###### The Heritage Hall Museum offers several levels of membership to its patrons.  
Thanks to your support, the arts are alive in Talladega County.

[Membership Application](https://www.heritagehallmuseum.org/_files/ugd/c9df84_8dd2fc03040249b5ae540b99a12f0499.pdf)

** _Individual Membership - $40_**

Special events and activities designed especially for members; Invitations to exhibition preview parties for members; Notices and announcements of Museum events, programs and activities; Receive [NARM](https://narmassociation.org/) benefits 

Fully tax deductible 

$40.00

All the benefits of Individual Membership

collections_text:
HERITAGE HALL MUSEUM

AND ART CENTER

​

200 South Street E.

Talladega, AL 35160

HOURS

Tuesday - Friday 

10am - 4pm 

Or by special appointment

(256) 761-1364

​

See Our

[SCHEDULE OF EVENTS](https://www.heritagehallmuseum.org/scheduleofevents)

[](https://www.heritagehallmuseum.org/_files/ugd/c9df84_48eb89a960024621bf4d5380aadbc05c.pdf)

##### [HERITAGE HALL  
VIDEOS ON  
YOUTUBE](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCOq_V2537CtsWvHRgrVXbGg)

The Sense of Place explores Talladega’s rich history, offering insight into the events, people, and places that have shaped the community. Through photographs, artifacts, and archival materials, the exhibit captures Talladega’s spirit from its earliest days through periods of change and growth.

Now, the Heritage Hall Museum is expanding the story with a new series of oral history interviews featuring local residents, educators, artists, and community leaders. These personal stories preserve Talladega’s cultural heritage and bring its history to life.

By collecting these voices, the museum helps ensure future generations connect with the experiences and values that define this unique sense of place.

[](https://www.heritagehallmuseum.org/permanent-collection)

###### PERMANENT COLLECTION

[](https://www.heritagehallmuseum.org/copy-of-coming-soon-1)

Gee’s Bend Quilting Workshop – Stitch History with the Masters  

Join master quilters MaryAnn and China Pettway of the world-famous Gee’s Bend collective for a hands-on quilting workshop...
